20110111230154.000|20110111230157.000|TR0|could make you feel better.  We don't

20110111230159.000|20110111230201.000|TR0|make any difference, but we wish that we

20110111230219.000|20110111230221.000|TR0|Tucson right now?  This is where this

20110111230228.000|20110111230230.000|TR0|since Saturday morning?
20110111230230.000|20110111230232.000|TR0|
20110111230232.000|20110111230235.000|TR0|CANDIOTTI:  Well, the family has been 
20110111230235.000|20110111230237.000|TR0|holed up in the house ever since.  And, as 
20110111230237.000|20110111230239.000|TR0|you can imagine, because everyone is --

20110111230315.000|20110111230317.000|TR0|background, and how they might have 
20110111230317.000|20110111230320.000|TR0|intermingled with the other neighbors here.

20110111230324.000|20110111230326.000|TR0|are a family that pretty much kept to 
20110111230326.000|20110111230329.000|TR0|themselves, lived here a very long time.  
20110111230329.000|20110111230331.000|TR0|As you said, Jared grew up here.  The 
20110111230331.000|20110111230333.000|TR0|family has been here and from time to time 
20110111230333.000|20110111230335.000|TR0|would exchange some words with some of 
20110111230335.000|20110111230338.000|TR0|their neighbors in a friendly way.  But 
20110111230338.000|20110111230340.000|TR0|others talked about glaring looks or angry 
20110111230340.000|20110111230342.000|TR0|words over trash or this and that, this 
20110111230342.000|20110111230344.000|TR0|kind of thing, until Saturday.
20110111230344.000|20110111230347.000|TR0|
20110111230347.000|20110111230349.000|TR0|And on Saturday, one of the neighbors said 
20110111230349.000|20110111230351.000|TR0|that he happened to be standing outside.  
20110111230351.000|20110111230353.000|TR0|It was after the shooting happened and he 
20110111230353.000|20110111230356.000|TR0|saw that crime scene tape had been put up

20110111230402.000|20110111230405.000|TR0|Mr. Loughner drove up to the house.

20110111230416.000|20110111230418.000|TR0|at that point Mr. Loughner seemed very 
20110111230418.000|20110111230420.000|TR0|shaken, put his hand to his head, and

20110111230657.000|20110111230700.000|TR0|describes the confrontation he says 
20110111230700.000|20110111230702.000|TR0|Loughner had with Congresswoman Gabrielle 
20110111230702.000|20110111230704.000|TR0|Giffords at a 2007 event.  He says 
20110111230704.000|20110111230706.000|TR0|Loughner asked Giffords, what is 
20110111230706.000|20110111230709.000|TR0|government if words have no meaning?  
20110111230709.000|20110111230711.000|TR0|Tierney says Loughner dwelled on the fact 
20110111230711.000|20110111230713.000|TR0|that Giffords could not answer his 
20110111230713.000|20110111230715.000|TR0|question.
20110111230715.000|20110111230718.000|TR0|
20110111230718.000|20110111230720.000|TR0|Friends say, in his earlier years, there 
20110111230720.000|20110111230722.000|TR0|was not anything dark about Jared 
20110111230722.000|20110111230724.000|TR0|Loughner.  They describe him as a normal 
20110111230724.000|20110111230727.000|TR0|kid who played the saxophone.  A neighbor 
20110111230727.000|20110111230729.000|TR0|tells CNN good music came from that house 
20110111230729.000|20110111230731.000|TR0|and the neighbor believes the Loughners 
20110111230731.000|20110111230733.000|TR0|genuinely and deeply loved their son.
20110111230733.000|20110111230736.000|TR0|
20110111230736.000|20110111230738.000|TR0|But at some point in high school, 
20110111230738.000|20110111230740.000|TR0|acquaintances say Jared Loughner began to 
20110111230740.000|20110111230742.000|TR0|turn.  His recent writings according to 
20110111230742.000|20110111230745.000|TR0|Alan Lipman of the Center for the Study of 
20110111230745.000|20110111230747.000|TR0|Violence indicate serious delusion, like 
20110111230747.000|20110111230749.000|TR0|this posting believed to be from Loughner 
20110111230749.000|20110111230751.000|TR0|on YouTube.  "I know who is listening, 
20110111230751.000|20110111230754.000|TR0|government officials and the people."  And 
20110111230754.000|20110111230756.000|TR0|he describes mind control and brainwash 
20110111230756.000|20110111230758.000|TR0|methods.
20110111230758.000|20110111230800.000|TR0|
20110111230800.000|20110111230803.000|TR0|DR. ALAN LIPMAN, FOUNDER, CENTER FOR THE 
20110111230803.000|20110111230805.000|TR0|STUDY OF VIOLENCE: Classic signs of 
20110111230805.000|20110111230807.000|TR0|psychosis, showed clear signs in his 
20110111230807.000|20110111230809.000|TR0|writings.  Those writings, people were 
20110111230809.000|20110111230812.000|TR0|looking for whether he was on the left or 
20110111230812.000|20110111230814.000|TR0|the right.  He was neither.  He was 
20110111230814.000|20110111230816.000|TR0|incoherent.  Those were signs, classic 
20110111230816.000|20110111230818.000|TR0|signs, you would see in a psychiatric unit 
20110111230818.000|20110111230820.000|TR0|of formal thought disorder.
20110111230820.000|20110111230823.000|TR0|
20110111230823.000|20110111230825.000|TR0|(END VIDEOTAPE)      TODD:  And we're 
20110111230825.000|20110111230827.000|TR0|picking up more on Loughner's run-ins with 
20110111230827.000|20110111230829.000|TR0|the law.  CNN has learned from a law 
20110111230829.000|20110111230832.000|TR0|enforcement source he was arrested in 
20110111230832.000|20110111230834.000|TR0|October 2007 on a misdemeanor drug charge, 
20110111230834.000|20110111230836.000|TR0|went through a diversion program with the 
20110111230836.000|20110111230838.000|TR0|county attorney's office.
20110111230838.000|20110111230841.000|TR0|

20110111230859.000|20110111230901.000|TR0|worked over the years.
20110111230901.000|20110111230903.000|TR0|
20110111230903.000|20110111230905.000|TR0|TODD:  That's right.  We have found out 
20110111230905.000|20110111230908.000|TR0|that he worked in an Eddie Bauer store we 
20110111230908.000|20110111230910.000|TR0|believe in the Tucson area.  The company 
20110111230910.000|20110111230912.000|TR0|will only say that he did not work there 
20110111230912.000|20110111230914.000|TR0|at the time the shootings and that he had 
20110111230914.000|20110111230917.000|TR0|not worked there in more than a year.
20110111230917.000|20110111230919.000|TR0|

20110111230921.000|20110111230923.000|TR0|volunteered at the Pima County Animal Care 
20110111230923.000|20110111230926.000|TR0|Center last year as a dog walker, but the 
20110111230926.000|20110111230928.000|TR0|manager there told "The Times" that they 
20110111230928.000|20110111230930.000|TR0|had to let him go because he ignored their 
20110111230930.000|20110111230932.000|TR0|warnings not to walk the dogs in an area 
20110111230932.000|20110111230935.000|TR0|of that kennel where a dangerous virus had 
20110111230935.000|20110111230937.000|TR0|been detected, so, drips and drabs about 
20110111230937.000|20110111230939.000|TR0|where he worked over the last few years.
20110111230939.000|20110111230941.000|TR0|

20110111230944.000|20110111230946.000|TR0| Thanks very much, Brian, for that.
20110111230946.000|20110111230948.000|TR0|
20110111230948.000|20110111230950.000|TR0|Let's get the latest developments now.  
20110111230950.000|20110111230953.000|TR0|The congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords is 
20110111230953.000|20110111230955.000|TR0|now able to breathe on her own though a 
20110111230955.000|20110111230957.000|TR0|tube -- though a tube, I should say, is 
20110111230957.000|20110111230959.000|TR0|being used to protect her airway.
20110111230959.000|20110111231002.000|TR0|
20110111231002.000|20110111231004.000|TR0|Doctors say they are encouraged that she 
20110111231004.000|20110111231006.000|TR0|has done so well -- their words.  But her 
20110111231006.000|20110111231008.000|TR0|condition remains critical.  Five other 
20110111231008.000|20110111231011.000|TR0|shooting victims are still hospitalized.
20110111231011.000|20110111231013.000|TR0|
20110111231013.000|20110111231015.000|TR0|Arizona lawmakers have just passed without 
20110111231015.000|20110111231017.000|TR0|objection an emergency bill that will bar 
20110111231017.000|20110111231020.000|TR0|protesters from the fringe from getting 
20110111231020.000|20110111231022.000|TR0|within 300 feet of funeral services.  a 
20110111231022.000|20110111231024.000|TR0|controversial church group which has 
20110111231024.000|20110111231026.000|TR0|picketed funerals of AIDS victims, gays, 
20110111231026.000|20110111231028.000|TR0|U.S. troops, has said it will show up at 
20110111231028.000|20110111231031.000|TR0|the funeral of Christina Green.  That is 
20110111231031.000|20110111231033.000|TR0|the 9-year-old little girl who was killed 
20110111231033.000|20110111231035.000|TR0|in Tucson.
20110111231035.000|20110111231037.000|TR0|

20110111231040.000|20110111231042.000|TR0|shootings attended the political event 
20110111231042.000|20110111231044.000|TR0|with a family friend.  Now that friend is 
20110111231044.000|20110111231046.000|TR0|reliving the massacre from her hospital

20110111231055.000|20110111231058.000|TR0|Ted.

20110111231415.000|20110111231418.000|TR0|Will the shooting change any of the laws 
20110111231418.000|20110111231420.000|TR0|coming out of Washington?
20110111231420.000|20110111231422.000|TR0|
20110111231422.000|20110111231424.000|TR0|Jack Cafferty is here.  He has "The 
20110111231424.000|20110111231427.000|TR0|Cafferty File" -- Jack.
20110111231427.000|20110111231429.000|TR0|
20110111231429.000|20110111231431.000|TR0|JACK CAFFERTY, CNN ANCHOR:  It's a debate 
20110111231431.000|20110111231433.000|TR0|almost as old as the country itself: 
20110111231433.000|20110111231435.000|TR0|whether it's a good idea for private 
20110111231435.000|20110111231438.000|TR0|citizens to own guns.
20110111231438.000|20110111231440.000|TR0|
20110111231440.000|20110111231442.000|TR0|And when something like the Tucson 
20110111231442.000|20110111231444.000|TR0|massacre happens, that debate roars to 
20110111231444.000|20110111231447.000|TR0|life all over again.
20110111231447.000|20110111231449.000|TR0|
20110111231449.000|20110111231451.000|TR0|It was remarkably easy for the shooter, 
20110111231451.000|20110111231453.000|TR0|Jared Lee Loughner, to get his hands on a 
20110111231453.000|20110111231456.000|TR0|gun in Arizona, the state that has some of 
20110111231456.000|20110111231458.000|TR0|the laxest gun laws in the country.
20110111231458.000|20110111231500.000|TR0|
20110111231500.000|20110111231502.000|TR0|The 22-year-old kid passed an instant 
20110111231502.000|20110111231505.000|TR0|background check in a sporting goods store 
20110111231505.000|20110111231507.000|TR0|and then bought a Glock 19, a 
20110111231507.000|20110111231509.000|TR0|.9-millimeter semiautomatic pistol.  He 
20110111231509.000|20110111231511.000|TR0|also bought an oversized magazine that 
20110111231511.000|20110111231514.000|TR0|allowed him to fire 33 shots without 
20110111231514.000|20110111231516.000|TR0|reloading, instead of the standard 10.  
20110111231516.000|20110111231518.000|TR0|Some lawmakers want to ban these oversized 
20110111231518.000|20110111231520.000|TR0|magazines nationwide.
20110111231520.000|20110111231523.000|TR0|
20110111231523.000|20110111231525.000|TR0|They're already outlawed in about six 
20110111231525.000|20110111231527.000|TR0|states, but not Arizona.
20110111231527.000|20110111231529.000|TR0|
20110111231529.000|20110111231532.000|TR0|The recent law there allows anybody over 
20110111231532.000|20110111231534.000|TR0|the age of 21 to carry a gun without a 
20110111231534.000|20110111231536.000|TR0|permit.  Guns are allowed almost 
20110111231536.000|20110111231538.000|TR0|everywhere in Arizona, the state capitol, 
20110111231538.000|20110111231541.000|TR0|public buildings, a lot of them, at least, 
20110111231541.000|20110111231543.000|TR0|in places that serve alcohol and on school 
20110111231543.000|20110111231545.000|TR0|grounds.
20110111231545.000|20110111231547.000|TR0|
20110111231547.000|20110111231550.000|TR0|Meanwhile, by many accounts, young 
20110111231550.000|20110111231552.000|TR0|Loughner is being described as mentally 
20110111231552.000|20110111231554.000|TR0|unstable and someone who should never have 
20110111231554.000|20110111231556.000|TR0|been allowed to buy a weapon in the first 
20110111231556.000|20110111231559.000|TR0|place.
20110111231559.000|20110111231601.000|TR0|
20110111231601.000|20110111231603.000|TR0|The military rejected him for failing a 
20110111231603.000|20110111231605.000|TR0|drug test.  Loughner had five run-ins with 
20110111231605.000|20110111231608.000|TR0|community college police before he was 
20110111231608.000|20110111231610.000|TR0|finally kicked out of school for 
20110111231610.000|20110111231612.000|TR0|disruptive activity.
20110111231612.000|20110111231614.000|TR0|
20110111231614.000|20110111231617.000|TR0|But instead of becoming stricter, the 
20110111231617.000|20110111231619.000|TR0|nation's gun laws have actually become 
20110111231619.000|20110111231621.000|TR0|more lax in recent years.  Examples 
20110111231621.000|20110111231623.000|TR0|include the removal of Washington, D.C.'s 
20110111231623.000|20110111231626.000|TR0|handgun ban and an amendment that allows 
20110111231626.000|20110111231628.000|TR0|gun owners to carry concealed and loaded 
20110111231628.000|20110111231630.000|TR0|weapons in our national parks.
20110111231630.000|20110111231632.000|TR0|

20110111231744.000|20110111231746.000|TR0|BLITZER:  And joining us now, Professor 
20110111231746.000|20110111231749.000|TR0|Alan Dershowitz of the Harvard Law School.
20110111231749.000|20110111231751.000|TR0|
20110111231751.000|20110111231753.000|TR0|Alan, thanks very much for coming in.
20110111231753.000|20110111231755.000|TR0|
20110111231755.000|20110111231758.000|TR0|Based on what you know -- and it's very, 
20110111231758.000|20110111231800.000|TR0|very early in this process right now -- is 
20110111231800.000|20110111231802.000|TR0|he likely to be executed or get life 
20110111231802.000|20110111231804.000|TR0|without the possibility of parole or 
20110111231804.000|20110111231807.000|TR0|something else?
20110111231807.000|20110111231809.000|TR0|
20110111231809.000|20110111231811.000|TR0|ALAN DERSHOWITZ, AUTHOR, "THE CASE FOR 
20110111231811.000|20110111231813.000|TR0|MORAL CLARITY: ISRAEL, HAMAS AND GAZA":  
20110111231813.000|20110111231816.000|TR0|Well, I think it is very likely they will 
20110111231816.000|20110111231818.000|TR0|seek the death penalty, because it gives 
20110111231818.000|20110111231820.000|TR0|the prosecution an advantage in jury 
20110111231820.000|20110111231822.000|TR0|selection to have jurors excluded who are 
20110111231822.000|20110111231825.000|TR0|opposed to the death penalty.
20110111231825.000|20110111231827.000|TR0|
20110111231827.000|20110111231829.000|TR0|This is a very serious crime, so 
20110111231829.000|20110111231831.000|TR0|politically they will be motivated to seek 
20110111231831.000|20110111231834.000|TR0|the death penalty.  Whether they get it or 
20110111231834.000|20110111231836.000|TR0|not will depend on the nature of the jury. 
20110111231836.000|20110111231838.000|TR0| The jury ironically may be somewhat more 
20110111231838.000|20110111231840.000|TR0|sympathetic in Arizona, because Arizona 
20110111231840.000|20110111231842.000|TR0|has a strong gun culture, that some jurors 
20110111231842.000|20110111231845.000|TR0|might think, gee, we don't want to blame 
20110111231845.000|20110111231847.000|TR0|this on guns, we don't want to blame this 
20110111231847.000|20110111231849.000|TR0|on the rhetoric.  Maybe we just blame it 
20110111231849.000|20110111231851.000|TR0|on the fact that he's insane or at least 
20110111231851.000|20110111231854.000|TR0|crazy enough so that he does not get the 
20110111231854.000|20110111231856.000|TR0|death penalty.
20110111231856.000|20110111231858.000|TR0|
20110111231858.000|20110111231900.000|TR0|You know, he has a very good lawyer.  The 
20110111231900.000|20110111231903.000|TR0|lawyer has to play all those angles.
20110111231903.000|20110111231905.000|TR0|
20110111231905.000|20110111231907.000|TR0|BLITZER:  But getting the insanity defense 
20110111231907.000|20110111231909.000|TR0|to work, you have to show that this 
20110111231909.000|20110111231912.000|TR0|individual could not differentiate between 
20110111231912.000|20110111231914.000|TR0|right and wrong.
20110111231914.000|20110111231916.000|TR0|
20110111231916.000|20110111231918.000|TR0|And at least based on his initial 
20110111231918.000|20110111231921.000|TR0|appearance in court, he seemed to answer 
20110111231921.000|20110111231923.000|TR0|the judge's questions.  He seemed cogent. 
20110111231923.000|20110111231925.000|TR0|He seemed relatively reasonable, at least 
20110111231925.000|20110111231927.000|TR0|during that 15-minute appearance.
20110111231927.000|20110111231930.000|TR0|
20110111231930.000|20110111231932.000|TR0|DERSHOWITZ:  Well, many insane people and 
20110111231932.000|20110111231934.000|TR0|seriously mentally ill people seem very 
20110111231934.000|20110111231936.000|TR0|reasonable.
20110111231936.000|20110111231939.000|TR0|
20110111231939.000|20110111231941.000|TR0|But it is a very daunting defense to 
20110111231941.000|20110111231943.000|TR0|raise.  He has to show that he did not 
20110111231943.000|20110111231945.000|TR0|understand the nature and quality or the 
20110111231945.000|20110111231948.000|TR0|wrongfulness of his act.  And he has the 
20110111231948.000|20110111231950.000|TR0|burden of proving it by clear and 
20110111231950.000|20110111231952.000|TR0|convincing evidence.  Very, very hard to 
20110111231952.000|20110111231954.000|TR0|mount a successful insanity defense after 
20110111231954.000|20110111231957.000|TR0|the Hinckley acquittal for the shooting of 
20110111231957.000|20110111231959.000|TR0|Ronald Reagan.
20110111231959.000|20110111232001.000|TR0|
20110111232001.000|20110111232003.000|TR0|Much easier to get mental illness as a 
20110111232003.000|20110111232006.000|TR0|mitigating factor to reduce the death 
20110111232006.000|20110111232008.000|TR0|penalty to life imprisonment.  And that 
20110111232008.000|20110111232010.000|TR0|may be the strategy the lawyer tries.  The 
20110111232010.000|20110111232012.000|TR0|lawyer may also try to raise an insanity 
20110111232012.000|20110111232015.000|TR0|defense knowing that she will lose in 
20110111232015.000|20110111232017.000|TR0|order to soften up the jury for the 
20110111232017.000|20110111232019.000|TR0|possibility of a mitigation on capital 
20110111232019.000|20110111232021.000|TR0|punishment.
20110111232021.000|20110111232024.000|TR0|
20110111232024.000|20110111232026.000|TR0|BLITZER:  Listen to one of his classmates 
20110111232026.000|20110111232028.000|TR0|at that community college speak about him. 
20110111232028.000|20110111232030.000|TR0| I will play the clip.  Listen to this.
20110111232030.000|20110111232033.000|TR0|
20110111232033.000|20110111232035.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)
20110111232035.000|20110111232037.000|TR0|
20110111232037.000|20110111232039.000|TR0|DON COOROUGH, FORMER CLASSMATE OF JARED 
20110111232039.000|20110111232041.000|TR0|LEE LOUGHNER:  The first time I was really 
20110111232041.000|20110111232044.000|TR0|struck by him was because he used 
20110111232044.000|20110111232046.000|TR0|inappropriate reactions to people's 
20110111232046.000|20110111232048.000|TR0|emotional content.  He would laugh at 
20110111232048.000|20110111232050.000|TR0|things that were sad.  He just didn't seem 
20110111232050.000|20110111232053.000|TR0|to -- to be aware of what was going on.
20110111232053.000|20110111232055.000|TR0|
20110111232055.000|20110111232057.000|TR0|(END VIDEO CLIP)
20110111232057.000|20110111232059.000|TR0|
20110111232059.000|20110111232102.000|TR0|BLITZER:  And another one of his 
20110111232102.000|20110111232104.000|TR0|professors at Pima Community College said: 
20110111232104.000|20110111232106.000|TR0|"Someone's whose brains were scrambled.  
20110111232106.000|20110111232108.000|TR0|His thoughts were unrelated to anything in 
20110111232108.000|20110111232111.000|TR0|the world.  He always was looking away, 
20110111232111.000|20110111232113.000|TR0|not out of the window, but like someone 
20110111232113.000|20110111232115.000|TR0|watching a scene play out in his mind."
20110111232115.000|20110111232117.000|TR0|
20110111232117.000|20110111232120.000|TR0|That makes it sound like this was a very 
20110111232120.000|20110111232122.000|TR0|disturbed individual.
20110111232122.000|20110111232124.000|TR0|
20110111232124.000|20110111232126.000|TR0|DERSHOWITZ:  The problem is being 
20110111232126.000|20110111232129.000|TR0|disturbed or even being seriously mentally 
20110111232129.000|20110111232131.000|TR0|ill does not constitute an insanity 
20110111232131.000|20110111232133.000|TR0|defense under the federal statute.
20110111232133.000|20110111232135.000|TR0|
20110111232135.000|20110111232138.000|TR0|The statute specifically says that serious 
20110111232138.000|20110111232140.000|TR0|mental illness alone, without the 
20110111232140.000|20110111232142.000|TR0|incapacity to understand the nature and 
20110111232142.000|20110111232144.000|TR0|quality or wrongfulness of the conduct, is 
20110111232144.000|20110111232147.000|TR0|not a defense.  So the drafters went out 
20110111232147.000|20110111232149.000|TR0|of their way to say, no matter how sick 
20110111232149.000|20110111232151.000|TR0|you are or mentally ill you are, you don't 
20110111232151.000|20110111232153.000|TR0|get a defense unless you can demonstrate 
20110111232153.000|20110111232156.000|TR0|by clear and convincing evidence that your 
20110111232156.000|20110111232158.000|TR0|mental illness affected your inability -- 
20110111232158.000|20110111232200.000|TR0|your ability to appreciate the 
20110111232200.000|20110111232202.000|TR0|wrongfulness of your conduct.
20110111232202.000|20110111232205.000|TR0|
20110111232205.000|20110111232207.000|TR0|And the fact that he planned it, the fact 
20110111232207.000|20110111232209.000|TR0|that he seemed reasonable will have a 
20110111232209.000|20110111232211.000|TR0|great influence on the jury, under the 
20110111232211.000|20110111232214.000|TR0|instruction they will get relating to 
20110111232214.000|20110111232216.000|TR0|insanity.  So I think it is very uphill 
20110111232216.000|20110111232218.000|TR0|for him to be able to succeed on an 
20110111232218.000|20110111232220.000|TR0|insanity defense, but I think he has a 
20110111232220.000|20110111232223.000|TR0|reasonable chance of being able to succeed 
20110111232223.000|20110111232225.000|TR0|on mental illness as a mitigating factor.
20110111232225.000|20110111232227.000|TR0|
20110111232227.000|20110111232229.000|TR0|BLITZER:  Is it possible he might plead 
20110111232229.000|20110111232232.000|TR0|guilty and just beg for mercy to the 
20110111232232.000|20110111232234.000|TR0|court?  Is that at all realistic?  And 
20110111232234.000|20110111232236.000|TR0|would the prosecution, the federal 
20110111232236.000|20110111232238.000|TR0|prosecutors in this case accept a guilty 
20110111232238.000|20110111232241.000|TR0|plea for something less than the death 
20110111232241.000|20110111232243.000|TR0|sentence?
20110111232243.000|20110111232245.000|TR0|
20110111232245.000|20110111232247.000|TR0|DERSHOWITZ:  Well, you don't plead guilty 
20110111232247.000|20110111232249.000|TR0|to the death sentence. You plead guilty 
20110111232249.000|20110111232252.000|TR0|only to the crime.  And if he were to want 
20110111232252.000|20110111232254.000|TR0|to plead guilty, the prosecutors would 
20110111232254.000|20110111232256.000|TR0|have no choice but to accept that.
20110111232256.000|20110111232258.000|TR0|
20110111232258.000|20110111232301.000|TR0|But then there'd be a trial essentially on 
20110111232301.000|20110111232303.000|TR0|whether he gets the death penalty.  His 
20110111232303.000|20110111232305.000|TR0|lawyer may want him to plead guilty.  That 
20110111232305.000|20110111232307.000|TR0|may be a good tactic.  But he may not want 
20110111232307.000|20110111232310.000|TR0|to plead guilty.  There is a recent case 
20110111232310.000|20110111232312.000|TR0|in the Supreme Court where a defendant did 
20110111232312.000|20110111232314.000|TR0|not want to plead guilty.     And 
20110111232314.000|20110111232316.000|TR0|essentially the lawyer said, he did it, he 
20110111232316.000|20110111232319.000|TR0|did it, don't doubt he did, but just spare 
20110111232319.000|20110111232321.000|TR0|him the death penalty, and then he took it 
20110111232321.000|20110111232323.000|TR0|to the Supreme Court, saying his lawyer 
20110111232323.000|20110111232325.000|TR0|hadn't done a good job. And the Supreme 
20110111232325.000|20110111232328.000|TR0|Court said, that's OK.  The lawyer can 
20110111232328.000|20110111232330.000|TR0|really concede that he did it and just 
20110111232330.000|20110111232332.000|TR0|plead for mercy.  That's OK.  And that may 
20110111232332.000|20110111232334.000|TR0|happen here.
20110111232334.000|20110111232337.000|TR0|

20110111232853.000|20110111232855.000|TR0|ALLAN CHERNOFF, CNN SENIOR CORRESPONDENT

20110111232858.000|20110111232900.000|TR0|unfolded, New York Congresswoman Carolyn 
20110111232900.000|20110111232902.000|TR0|McCarthy flashed back to a shooting on the 
20110111232902.000|20110111232904.000|TR0|Long Island Railroad when a gunman killed 
20110111232904.000|20110111232907.000|TR0|her husband, Dennis, and wounded her son 
20110111232907.000|20110111232909.000|TR0|Kevin 17 years ago.
20110111232909.000|20110111232911.000|TR0|
20110111232911.000|20110111232913.000|TR0|REP. CAROLYN MCCARTHY (D), NEW YORK:  When 
20110111232913.000|20110111232916.000|TR0|you hear about it, it hits at home and you 
20110111232916.000|20110111232918.000|TR0|go back to where you don't want to go.
20110111232918.000|20110111232920.000|TR0|
20110111232920.000|20110111232922.000|TR0|CHERNOFF:  In spite of her pain, McCarthy 
20110111232922.000|20110111232925.000|TR0|has no plan to call for a limit on gun 
20110111232925.000|20110111232927.000|TR0|sales.  Instead, she is proposing a ban on 
20110111232927.000|20110111232929.000|TR0|the sale to civilians of so-called 
20110111232929.000|20110111232931.000|TR0|extended magazines that hold more than 10 
20110111232931.000|20110111232934.000|TR0|bullets, the type of gun magazine that 
20110111232934.000|20110111232936.000|TR0|Jared Loughner allegedly used in Tucson.
20110111232936.000|20110111232938.000|TR0|
20110111232938.000|20110111232940.000|TR0|(on camera):  In this particular tragedy, 
20110111232940.000|20110111232943.000|TR0|would this have made a difference, the 
20110111232943.000|20110111232945.000|TR0|proposal you have?
20110111232945.000|20110111232947.000|TR0|
20110111232947.000|20110111232949.000|TR0|MCCARTHY:  Oh, absolutely.  Look at how 
20110111232949.000|20110111232952.000|TR0|many bullets he got off. And the majority 
20110111232952.000|20110111232954.000|TR0|of those bullets found a way to either 
20110111232954.000|20110111232956.000|TR0|kill someone or injure someone.
20110111232956.000|20110111232958.000|TR0|

20110111233001.000|20110111233003.000|TR0|had spent his ammunition and tried to 
20110111233003.000|20110111233005.000|TR0|reload were bystanders able to tackle him.
20110111233005.000|20110111233007.000|TR0|
20110111233007.000|20110111233010.000|TR0|But the Gun Owners of America argue, a 
20110111233010.000|20110111233012.000|TR0|limit on ammunition a limit on their 
20110111233012.000|20110111233014.000|TR0|Second Amendment right to bear arms.
20110111233014.000|20110111233016.000|TR0|
20110111233016.000|20110111233019.000|TR0|LARRY PRATT, GUN OWNERS OF AMERICA:  
20110111233019.000|20110111233021.000|TR0|People need large-capacity magazines if

20110111233032.000|20110111233034.000|TR0|refused to address the issue directly, 
20110111233034.000|20110111233037.000|TR0|saying only, "At this time, anything other 
20110111233037.000|20110111233039.000|TR0|than prayers for the victims and their 
20110111233039.000|20110111233041.000|TR0|families would be inappropriate."
20110111233041.000|20110111233043.000|TR0|
20110111233043.000|20110111233046.000|TR0|McCarthy, aware of the gun lobby's power, 
20110111233046.000|20110111233048.000|TR0|expects a huge challenge in getting her

20110111233050.000|20110111233052.000|TR0|after the latest horrific tragedy.
20110111233052.000|20110111233055.000|TR0|
20110111233055.000|20110111233057.000|TR0|CHERNOFF (on camera):  So, you are not 
20110111233057.000|20110111233059.000|TR0|confident that this proposal will actually 
20110111233059.000|20110111233101.000|TR0|become law?
20110111233101.000|20110111233103.000|TR0|
20110111233103.000|20110111233106.000|TR0|MCCARTHY:  I would say that I'm going to 
20110111233106.000|20110111233108.000|TR0|have a battle.

20110111233839.000|20110111233842.000|TR0|
20110111233842.000|20110111233844.000|TR0|FRIESE:  She's on a breathing machine.  
20110111233844.000|20110111233846.000|TR0|She has been on the ventilator since her 
20110111233846.000|20110111233848.000|TR0|admission to the ICU.  When someone in the 
20110111233848.000|20110111233851.000|TR0|ICU is on a breathing machine, we always 
20110111233851.000|20110111233853.000|TR0|attempt to wean the machine. Basically, 
20110111233853.000|20110111233855.000|TR0|weaning means transfer work of breathing 
20110111233855.000|20110111233857.000|TR0|from the machine to the patient.  We are 
20110111233857.000|20110111233900.000|TR0|always doing that.  The more work of 
20110111233900.000|20110111233902.000|TR0|breathing a patient does, the better.  The 
20110111233902.000|20110111233904.000|TR0|more negative pressure breathing the 
20110111233904.000|20110111233906.000|TR0|patient does the better.  So yes, we have 
20110111233906.000|20110111233909.000|TR0|been weaning her from the ventilator, and

20110111233931.000|20110111233933.000|TR0|very short acting so that, when we start

20110111233935.000|20110111233938.000|TR0|quickly and they put her in a sedated

20110111233949.000|20110111233951.000|TR0|when we turn it off, the effects of it 
20110111233951.000|20110111233953.000|TR0|wear away quickly, so we can get a good

20110111235033.000|20110111235036.000|TR0|are now confirmed dead, with 78 still 
20110111235036.000|20110111235038.000|TR0|missing.  Residents downstream are being

20110111235201.000|20110111235203.000|TR0|going on.  Thanks very much, Lisa, for 
20110111235203.000|20110111235205.000|TR0|that.
20110111235205.000|20110111235208.000|TR0|
20110111235208.000|20110111235210.000|TR0|It's one of the perils of public office.  
20110111235210.000|20110111235212.000|TR0|And when they trip, everyone seems to see 
20110111235212.000|20110111235214.000|TR0|it.  CNN's Jeanne Moos takes a "Most 
20110111235214.000|20110111235217.000|TR0|Unusual" look.

20110111235239.000|20110111235241.000|TR0|JACK CAFFERTY, CNN ANCHOR:  The question 
20110111235241.000|20110111235244.000|TR0|this hour is: Should the Tucson tragedy be 
20110111235244.000|20110111235246.000|TR0|enough to change this nation's gun laws?
20110111235246.000|20110111235248.000|TR0|
20110111235248.000|20110111235250.000|TR0|Stacy in Florida writes, "There are enough 
20110111235250.000|20110111235253.000|TR0|gun laws now that aren't enforced.  Gun 
20110111235253.000|20110111235255.000|TR0|laws and gun stores are for hunters.  The 
20110111235255.000|20110111235257.000|TR0|bad guys buy guns in the alley, and laws 
20110111235257.000|20110111235259.000|TR0|don't mean anything in the alley."
20110111235259.000|20110111235302.000|TR0|
20110111235302.000|20110111235304.000|TR0|Sarah in Florida: "We ought to take this 
20110111235304.000|20110111235306.000|TR0|as awake-up call.  A mentally unstable 
20110111235306.000|20110111235308.000|TR0|young man, who was thrown out of community 
20110111235308.000|20110111235311.000|TR0|college for his frightening, erratic 
20110111235311.000|20110111235313.000|TR0|behavior and was rejected by the U.S. 
20110111235313.000|20110111235315.000|TR0|Army, walked into a store and walked out 
20110111235315.000|20110111235317.000|TR0|with a gun.  Put your agenda aside for two 
20110111235317.000|20110111235320.000|TR0|seconds and think about that.  We should 
20110111235320.000|20110111235322.000|TR0|be ashamed of ourselves collectively as 
20110111235322.000|20110111235324.000|TR0|Americans for allowing something like that 
20110111235324.000|20110111235326.000|TR0|to happen."
20110111235326.000|20110111235329.000|TR0|
20110111235329.000|20110111235331.000|TR0|David in North Carolina says, "Our 
20110111235331.000|20110111235333.000|TR0|democracy ends when people lose their 
20110111235333.000|20110111235335.000|TR0|Second Amendment right to own and carry 
20110111235335.000|20110111235337.000|TR0|guns.  As long as the people own and carry 
20110111235337.000|20110111235340.000|TR0|guns, the government is held in check.  An 
20110111235340.000|20110111235342.000|TR0|unarmed population leads to tyranny and a 
20110111235342.000|20110111235344.000|TR0|dictatorship.  The Second Amendment is in 
20110111235344.000|20110111235346.000|TR0|the Constitution to protect the people 
20110111235346.000|20110111235349.000|TR0|from the government and keep potential 
20110111235349.000|20110111235351.000|TR0|tyrants and dictators in check."
20110111235351.000|20110111235353.000|TR0|

20110111235358.000|20110111235400.000|TR0|be affected.  Both sides of the discussion

20110111235402.000|20110111235404.000|TR0|want, and it will stalemate again in the

20110111235603.000|20110111235606.000|TR0|Stumbling on the world stage.  CNN's 
20110111235606.000|20110111235608.000|TR0|Jeanne Moos takes a "Most Unusual" look.
20110111235608.000|20110111235610.000|TR0|

20110111235612.000|20110111235615.000|TR0|
20110111235615.000|20110111235617.000|TR0|JEANNE MOOS, CNN CORRESPONDENT 
20110111235617.000|20110111235619.000|TR0|(voice-over):  For Secretary of State 
20110111235619.000|20110111235621.000|TR0|Hillary Clinton, it was a foreign trip 
20110111235621.000|20110111235624.000|TR0|with a little too much tripping.  Her 
20110111235624.000|20110111235626.000|TR0|aides say she was OK, unlike the last time 
20110111235626.000|20110111235628.000|TR0|she tripped while walking to the White 
20110111235628.000|20110111235630.000|TR0|House and broke her elbow.  She cited that 
20110111235630.000|20110111235633.000|TR0|injury when dismissing talk that her role 
20110111235633.000|20110111235635.000|TR0|in shaping foreign policy was being 
20110111235635.000|20110111235637.000|TR0|diminished.
20110111235637.000|20110111235639.000|TR0|
20110111235639.000|20110111235642.000|TR0|HILLARY CLINTON, SECRETARY OF STATE:  I 
20110111235642.000|20110111235644.000|TR0|broke my elbow, not my larynx.
20110111235644.000|20110111235646.000|TR0|
20110111235646.000|20110111235648.000|TR0|MOOS:  She's had a lot of practice 
20110111235648.000|20110111235651.000|TR0|boarding and exiting planes.
20110111235651.000|20110111235653.000|TR0|
20110111235653.000|20110111235655.000|TR0|(on camera) Steps are tricky enough, but 
20110111235655.000|20110111235657.000|TR0|imagine having a camera trained on your 
20110111235657.000|20110111235700.000|TR0|every arrival and departure.
20110111235700.000|20110111235702.000|TR0|
20110111235702.000|20110111235704.000|TR0|(voice-over) Presidents develop their own 
20110111235704.000|20110111235706.000|TR0|style.  President Obama prefers to jog.  
20110111235706.000|20110111235709.000|TR0|Bill Clinton was more leisurely, and 
20110111235709.000|20110111235711.000|TR0|George Bush occasionally clutched the 
20110111235711.000|20110111235713.000|TR0|railings, something Gerald Ford should 
20110111235713.000|20110111235715.000|TR0|have done.  His fall while deplaning in 
20110111235715.000|20110111235718.000|TR0|Austria has been embellished with sound 
20110111235718.000|20110111235720.000|TR0|effects and lives eternally on YouTube.  
20110111235720.000|20110111235722.000|TR0|President Ford even stumbled going up the 
20110111235722.000|20110111235724.000|TR0|steps.
20110111235724.000|20110111235727.000|TR0|
20110111235727.000|20110111235729.000|TR0|(on camera) And it's not just American 
20110111235729.000|20110111235731.000|TR0|officials who slip on the airplane stairs 
20110111235731.000|20110111235733.000|TR0|while everyone is staring.
20110111235733.000|20110111235736.000|TR0|
20110111235736.000|20110111235738.000|TR0|(voice-over) French President Nicolas 
20110111235738.000|20110111235740.000|TR0|Sarkozy managed to stay on his feet, but 
20110111235740.000|20110111235742.000|TR0|just barely.
20110111235742.000|20110111235744.000|TR0|
20110111235744.000|20110111235747.000|TR0|So far President Obama hasn't lost his 
20110111235747.000|20110111235749.000|TR0|footing, but he has lost his BlackBerry 
20110111235749.000|20110111235751.000|TR0|while jogging up the stairs, and he bonked 
20110111235751.000|20110111235753.000|TR0|his head while boarding the presidential 
20110111235753.000|20110111235756.000|TR0|chopper.  But then, so did President Bush 
20110111235756.000|20110111235758.000|TR0|more than once, and Michelle Obama has 
20110111235758.000|20110111235800.000|TR0|banged her head on Air Force One.
20110111235800.000|20110111235802.000|TR0|
20110111235802.000|20110111235805.000|TR0|(on camera) Even presidential pets know 
20110111235805.000|20110111235807.000|TR0|better than to trust those airport steps.
20110111235807.000|20110111235809.000|TR0|
20110111235809.000|20110111235811.000|TR0|(voice-over) President Bush had to give 
20110111235811.000|20110111235814.000|TR0|Barney a push to get him to go up, and he 
20110111235814.000|20110111235816.000|TR0|had to nudge Spot to get her to go down.  
20110111235816.000|20110111235818.000|TR0|As we learned in a Jimmy Kimmel bit, the 
20110111235818.000|20110111235820.000|TR0|only thing more treacherous than using the 
20110111235820.000|20110111235823.000|TR0|stairs is having them go nowhere.

20110111235832.000|20110111235834.000|TR0|suffered only minor bruising.
